details.summary: UK and Indonesia enjoy a close relationship, with many common interests and values. We are partners in challenges like terrorism and global warming, and work together closely within the G20. We are also here to support and protect UK interests in Timor Leste.
details.description:
Britain is a leading investor in this country. In April 2012 the Prime Minister and President Yudhoyono announced a commitment to double trade (goods & services) by 2015 to £4.4 billion.

We cooperate with international and local agencies to address global challenges including human rights and democracy, regional security, prosperity and climate change.

We also provide assistance, services and practical advice to British nationals visiting or living in Indonesia, and we deal with visa applications for those who wish to enter the UK to visit, study, live or work.
details.services:
Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

Births, deaths and marriages

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas, and legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Passports and emergency travel documents

How to renew or replace your British passport when visiting the UK and information on getting replacement travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Travel advice

Information on staying safe and avoiding problems when living or travelling abroad, with links to our embassies, high commissions and other diplomatic posts across the world.

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

details.access_and_opening_times:
Disabled access

The Foreign & Commonwealth Office and the British Embassy in Jakarta are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes, however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled staff and visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at the Embassy. We hope this information is helpful.

General Physical Access

There is a disabled access through the pedestrian entrance. If you require assistance, please telephone us in advance of your visit so that we can ensure that we are able to provide access for you and allow your vehicle access to the Embassy Compound (Please call +62 (021) 2356 5200 and ask for the Deputy Security Manager). Wheelchair access to the Embassy is via the front door. The Embassy only has the facility to allow a wheelchair with a maximum width of 750mm. There is access to the Consulate and Visa section located in the adjacent Deutsche Bank Building.

  • Steps and Staircases: all internal staircases have hand rails on both sides.

  • Lifts: There is a lift to all floors of the Embassy.

  • Toilets: a disabled toilet is located on the ground floor of the Embassy in Management Section.

  • Parking: a disabled parking spot is available by arrangement.

  • Floor coverings: floor coverings are safe and even.

  • Doors: if necessary, the staff can assist in opening doors.

  • Lighting: adequate throughout.

  • Telephones: accessible to wheelchair users.

Access for Visually Impaired Visitors

  • Signs: generally clear and easy to read.

  • Guide dogs: guide dogs are welcome.

Access for Deaf/Hard of Hearing Visitors

  • Microphones: are installed in all Reception areas.

  • Hearing dogs: hearing dogs are welcome.

Contact Us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that they may be inaccessible to you, please contact Deputy Security Manager, or Office Manager, who will find an alternative way of providing access for you.

Public holidays

British Embassy Official Holidays in 2013:

  • Tuesday 1 January New Year’s Day (Indonesian & UK holiday)

  • Friday 29 March Good Friday (Indonesian & UK Privilege holiday)

  • Monday 1 April Easter Monday (UK Holiday)

  • Monday 6 May May Bank Holiday (UK Holiday)

  • Friday 24 May QBP Privilege Holiday (UK Holiday)

  • Monday 27 May Spring Bank Holiday (UK holiday)

  • Thursday 6 June Mohammad’s Ascension (Indonesian Holiday)

  • Thursday 8 August Hari Raya Eid Idul-Fitri (Indonesian holiday)

  • Friday 9 August Hari Raya Eid Idul-Fitri (Indonesian holiday)

  • Tuesday 15 October Hari Raya Eid Idul-Adha (Indonesian holiday)

  • Tuesday 5 November Islamic New Year (Indonesian holiday)

  • Wednesday 25 December Christmas Day Holiday (Indonesian and UK Privilege holiday)

  • Thursday 26 December Boxing Day Christmas Holiday (UK holiday & Indonesian holiday)

  • Friday 27 December Christmas Holiday (Indonesian and UK Privilege holiday)

details.access_and_opening_times:
Making a consular appointment

Our embassy and consulate deal with a large number of urgent cases each year. Before contacting the embassy or consulate with non-urgent enquiries, please read our Support for British nationals abroad: a guide to see if the information you need is there. If you still cannot find the information you need, you can contact our Consular team at consulate.jakarta@fco.gov.uk To make an appointment with the Consular section, please visit our Clickbook Appointment site.

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that they may be inaccessible to you, please contact Deputy Security Manager, or Office Manager, who will find an alternative way of providing access for you.

details.summary: We work in Indonesia on climate change and sustainable development
details.description:
Support to Indonesia is now channelled through the cross-Government UK Climate Change Unit (UKCCU), which combines the Department for International Development (DFID), the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) and the Department for Energy and Climate Change (DECC), working in the areas of sustainable development and climate change.

The purpose of the UKCCU is to support Indonesia in meeting its national objectives and targets on low carbon, sustainable development (including forestry and land-use change) and on achieving a progressive global deal through international climate negotiations. In doing this, the work of the UKCCU supports the international priorities of the UK’s Carbon Plan (2011).

details.summary: UK Trade & Investment (UKTI) helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy.
details.description:
UKTI offers expertise and contacts through its extensive network of specialists in the UK, and in British embassies and other diplomatic offices around the world. We provide companies with the tools they require to be competitive on the world stage.

Responsibilities

UKTI in Indonesia helps companies in Britain increase their competitiveness through overseas trade in Indonesia. We also offer professional, authoritative and personalised assistance to help companies in Indonesia locate and expand in the UK.

You can find out more about how we are improving business with Indonesia.
details.services:
Start a business in the UK

UKTI offers dedicated, professional, personalised assistance to help you locate and expand your business in the UK, read about our investment services or contact us to find out more.

Export from the UK

UKTI can assist you on every step of the exporting journey in both the UK and overseas, read about our exporting services or contact us to find out more.

Events

UKTI and its partners stage events in the UK and abroad to help companies looking to export. You can browse scheduled events and register for alerts.

Business opportunities

UKTI is always looking to provide an international network of opportunities for UK Companies looking to export. You can search these opportunities and register for alerts.
